message.entry: Path argument must contain minimum of 3 path points for optimization.
Invalid value for path argument. Value must be a double matrix of size N-by-2 or N-by-3.
Invalid argument at position 2. The second argument of optimizePath function must be binaryOccupancyMap, occupancyMap, vehicleCostmap, or optimizePathOptions class.
ObstacleCutOffDistance must be greater than ObstacleInclusionDistance.
ReferenceDeltaTime*MaxVelocity is greater than the diagonal of the map. Either increase map size, reduce ReferenceDeltaTime, or reduce MaxVelocity.
Some or all poses in the path are out of map bounds. Path must be in world frame. Choose a different path or map.
Start state of the path is not obstacle-free. Choose a different start state or map.
Goal state of the path is not obstacle-free. Choose a different goal state or map.

ReferenceDeltaTime * MaxVelocity is greater than 2*ObstacleSafetyMargin, this can lead to path skipping over obstacles. Either increase ObstacleSafetyMargin, reduce ReferenceDeltaTime, or reduce MaxVelocity.
2*ObstacleSafetyMargin is greater than the diagonal of the map. Increase map size or reduce ObstacleSafetyMargin.
Unable to reduce the number of poses in path less than the value of MaxPathStates. Either increase the value of MaxPathStates or ReferenceDeltaTime.
Number of poses in the path is large. Reduce the number of poses in the path or increase the value of ReferenceDeltaTime.

The input path must contain at least one pose where the travel direction is non-orthogonal to the orientation vector. The travel direction is distance vector connecting the consecutive poses of the input path.
The angle differences between consecutive poses in the input path are more than 90 degrees. Improve the output by interpolating input path to reduce the angle differences.
